004
005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007import java.util.function.Consumer;
008
009/**
010 * Event listener. This calls back to a callback function when an event matching the specified mask
011 * occurs. The callback function is called asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to
012 * use synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state from the callback function.
013 */
014public final class NetworkTableListener implements AutoCloseable {
015  /**
016   * Create a listener for changes to topics with names that start with any of the given prefixes.
017   * This creates a corresponding internal subscriber with the lifetime of the listener.
018   *
019   * @param inst Instance
020   * @param prefixes Topic name string prefixes
021   * @param eventMask Bitmask of NetworkTableEvent flags values
022   * @param listener Listener function
023   * @return Listener
024   */
025  public static NetworkTableListener createListener(
026      NetworkTableInstance inst,
027      String[] prefixes,
028      int eventMask,
029      Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
030    return new NetworkTableListener(inst, inst.addListener(prefixes, eventMask, listener));
031  }
032
033  /**
034   * Create a listener for changes on a particular topic. This creates a corresponding internal
035   * subscriber with the lifetime of the listener.
036   *
037   * @param topic Topic
038   * @param eventMask Bitmask of NetworkTableEvent flags values
039   * @param listener Listener function
040   * @return Listener
041   */
042  public static NetworkTableListener createListener(
043      Topic topic, int eventMask, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
044    NetworkTableInstance inst = topic.getInstance();
045    return new NetworkTableListener(inst, inst.addListener(topic, eventMask, listener));
046  }
047
048  /**
049   * Create a listener for topic changes on a subscriber. This does NOT keep the subscriber active.
050   *
051   * @param subscriber Subscriber
052   * @param eventMask Bitmask of NetworkTableEvent flags values
053   * @param listener Listener function
054   * @return Listener
055   */
056  public static NetworkTableListener createListener(
057      Subscriber subscriber, int eventMask, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
058    NetworkTableInstance inst = subscriber.getTopic().getInstance();
059    return new NetworkTableListener(inst, inst.addListener(subscriber, eventMask, listener));
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Create a listener for topic changes on a subscriber. This does NOT keep the subscriber active.
064   *
065   * @param subscriber Subscriber
066   * @param eventMask Bitmask of NetworkTableEvent flags values
067   * @param listener Listener function
068   * @return Listener
069   */
070  public static NetworkTableListener createListener(
071      MultiSubscriber subscriber, int eventMask, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
072    NetworkTableInstance inst = subscriber.getInstance();
073    return new NetworkTableListener(inst, inst.addListener(subscriber, eventMask, listener));
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * Create a listener for topic changes on an entry.
078   *
079   * @param entry Entry
080   * @param eventMask Bitmask of NetworkTableEvent flags values
081   * @param listener Listener function
082   * @return Listener
083   */
084  public static NetworkTableListener createListener(
085      NetworkTableEntry entry, int eventMask, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
086    NetworkTableInstance inst = entry.getInstance();
087    return new NetworkTableListener(inst, inst.addListener(entry, eventMask, listener));
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * Create a connection listener.
092   *
093   * @param inst instance
094   * @param immediateNotify notify listener of all existing connections
095   * @param listener listener function
096   * @return Listener
097   */
098  public static NetworkTableListener createConnectionListener(
099      NetworkTableInstance inst, boolean immediateNotify, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
100    return new NetworkTableListener(inst, inst.addConnectionListener(immediateNotify, listener));
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Create a listener for log messages. By default, log messages are sent to stderr; this function
105   * sends log messages with the specified levels to the provided callback function instead. The
106   * callback function will only be called for log messages with level greater than or equal to
107   * minLevel and less than or equal to maxLevel; messages outside this range will be silently
108   * ignored.
109   *
110   * @param inst instance
111   * @param minLevel minimum log level
112   * @param maxLevel maximum log level
113   * @param listener listener function
114   * @return Listener
115   */
116  public static NetworkTableListener createLogger(
117      NetworkTableInstance inst, int minLevel, int maxLevel, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
118    return new NetworkTableListener(inst, inst.addLogger(minLevel, maxLevel, listener));
119  }
120
121  @Override
122  public synchronized void close() {
123    if (m_handle != 0) {
124      m_inst.removeListener(m_handle);
125      m_handle = 0;
126    }
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
131   *
132   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
133   */
134  public boolean isValid() {
135    return m_handle != 0;
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Gets the native handle.
140   *
141   * @return Native handle
142   */
143  public int getHandle() {
144    return m_handle;
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Wait for the topic listener queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
149   * testing. This blocks until either the topic listener queue is empty (e.g. there are no more
150   * events that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
151   *
152   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
153   *     block indefinitely
154   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
155   */
156  public boolean waitForQueue(double timeout) {
157    return m_inst.waitForListenerQueue(timeout);
158  }
159
160  private NetworkTableListener(NetworkTableInstance inst, int handle) {
161    m_inst = inst;
162    m_handle = handle;
163  }
164
165  private final NetworkTableInstance m_inst;
166  private int m_handle;
167}
